Inside the palace, the hall has some lovely portraits of the Mukne clan. Across the river from Osho-land is the Aga Khan Palace and Gandhi National Memorial Pune. The building was given over to the British during the historic house arrest in 1942 of Mahatma Gandhi, his wife Kasturba, and his secretary Mahadev Desai. The Mahatma spent two years in confinement in this palace, during which he lost both Kasturba and Desai. There is a moving samadhi to these two within the palace grounds. The Mahatma Gandhi Museum here consists of a few rooms with photographs.
